message_1: Find the solution set to the inequality: 3x + 5 < 22, and graph the solution on the number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 3x + 5 < 22, we'll first isolate the variable x by following these steps:

1. Subtract 5 from both sides of the inequality:
3x + 5 - 5 < 22 - 5
3x < 17

2. Divide both sides of the inequality by 3:
3x/3 < 17/3
x < 17/3

So the solution set to the inequality is x < 17/3.

To graph the solution on the number line, follow these steps:

1. Draw a number line and mark the point 17/3 on it.

2. Since the inequality is "less than" (x < 17/3), we'll use an open circle at the point 17/3 to indicate that the value 17/3 is not included in the solution set.

3. Shade the region to the left of the open circle, indicating that all values of x less than 17/3 are part of the solution set.

The graph of the solution set on the number line will have an open circle at 17/3 and the region to the left of the open circle will be shaded.
